replies.bodyText: Entities with that interface are a Mount, which makes them mountable. I find this name more grammatical.
replies.author: Sollace

replies.bodyText: Yeah, Saddleable is incorrect because not all entities with it can be "saddled" which sounds wrong anyway. Mountable or even just Mount is a more accurate name.
replies.author: Prospector

replies.bodyText:
No, this is just saddle logic and is mainly used by dispenser to install saddles. The method setSaddled is just installing saddle and passing the sound category for the saddling sound to play in (i.e. block sound category for dispensers and player sound category for players)
the other two methods checks if the entity already has saddle or if it can have saddle installed at current state
replies.author: liach

replies.bodyText: If canBeSaddled is false, then that means the entity is not saddleable and therefore the class name is incorrect. See how llamas always return false, an entity that is not saddleable and implements the interface.
replies.author: Prospector

replies.bodyText: Yes because one of its parent classes is saddleable. Show me how this interface ever relates to mounting logic. Also this class is already mapped in latest yarn
replies.author: liach

replies.bodyText: It's an interface that every mountable animal in the game implements, and the ones that are saddleable return true on canBeSaddled. It doesn't get much simpler than that.
replies.author: Prospector

replies.bodyText:
As far as I see from decompiled code this interface is 100% saddle related. It has nothing to do with "mounting".
@Prospector please read the code. How about minecarts boats, which are also mountable? If your theory is right, how about ravagers, which you consider mountable, but cannot have saddles installed (because they always come with one)?
replies.author: liach

replies.bodyText:
You keep dodging the fact that an interface you named Saddleable is used by entities which factually are not saddleable. Therefore, it's an incorrect name. The common link between the things that implement it are not whether or not they are saddleable, it's whether or not they are mountable. It's like naming BlockWithEntity something like ScreenHandlerEntityBlock. While yes, the interface does enable screen handler functionality within some subclasses, it is still implemented by blocks which do not use screen handlers, and therefore cannot be named after that part of its functionality.
You did bring up a good point, and that is that there are mobs that are mountable by other entities such as ravagers, chickens, and spiders. Therefore, I'd propose the name PlayerMountable.
replies.author: Prospector

replies.bodyText:
You keep dodging the fact that an interface you named Saddleable is used by entities which factually are not saddleable.

Because mojang doesn't want to refactor llama out of the horse inheritance tree just because of that saddleable interface. End of the story. Nowhere in code is this ever related to player mounting at all. If you name it, show evidence in code.
Again, again, again, we need evidence.

The common link between the things that implement it are not whether or not they are saddleable, it's whether or not they are mountable.

There is no mounting logic touched in this interface at all. It is just a coincidence that most tameable + mountable entities need saddles to mount, and the only one that does not need saddles extends from one that need saddles (Llama extends Donkey).
Your logic of basing this off this coincidence is just like attributing the correlation between ice cream sale and crime rate as causation.
replies.author: liach

replies.bodyText:
How about minecarts boats, which are also mountable?

You don't "mount" a minecart or boat, you "board" them. However you can "ride" both horses and minecarts.
replies.author: Earthcomputer

timeline.bodyText: This class is already mapped. This change is wrong, as it renames from a nonexistent file. (Should rename from Saddleable)
timeline.author: liach

replies.bodyText: This class was most definitely not mapped when I was working on this PR.
replies.author: Sollace

replies.bodyText:
This class was most definitely not mapped when I was working on this PR.

This isn't an excuse for you not to fix merge conflicts. There will be a format error, so please merge the current 20w15a branch and delete the Saddleable mapping to make the pr right. I am not asking you to take the Saddleable name, read my last comment again.
replies.author: liach

replies.bodyText: It should be named Saddleable, or something relating to saddles. It's ONLY implemented by entities that can have a saddle, and is only used by the saddle item and saddle dispenser behaviour.
replies.author: Earthcomputer

replies.bodyText:
This class was most definitely not mapped when I was working on this PR.

This isn't an excuse for you not to fix merge conflicts. There will be a format error, so please merge the current 20w15a branch and delete the Saddleable mapping to make the pr right. I am not asking you to take the Saddleable name, read my last comment again.

Why didn't you say so? Sure, I'll fix the conflict.
